Class amm.mail.Mailer 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class amm.mail.Mailer 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.lang.Thread
           |
           +----amm.mail.Mailer
public class Mailer
extends Thread
A class that connects to an SMTP server and sends an e-mail message. A class implementing MailSource must be passed to the Mailer to provide the content and destination of the message.
See Also:
MailSource

in
The input stream from the SMTP server.
line
The current line retrieved from the SMTP server.
out
The output stream to the SMTP server.
sock
The socket used to connect to the SMTP server.
source
The instance that will provide the content of the message.

Mailer(MailSource)
Creates a Mailer with the specified data source.

close()
Closes the connection to the SMTP server.
getLine()
Returns a line read from the SMTP server.
run()
When the Mailer is started, it gathers information from the MailSource, connects to the SMTP server, and sends the message.

source 
  protected MailSource source
The instance that will provide the content of the message.
sock 
  protected Socket sock
The socket used to connect to the SMTP server.
in 
  protected DataInputStream in
The input stream from the SMTP server.
out 
  protected PrintStream out
The output stream to the SMTP server.
line 
  protected String line
The current line retrieved from the SMTP server.

Mailer 
  public Mailer(MailSource source)
Creates a Mailer with the specified data source.
Parameters:
source - The MailSource that will provide the content of the message.

run 
  public void run()
When the Mailer is started, it gathers information from the MailSource, connects to the SMTP server, and sends the message.
Overrides:
run in class Thread
getLine 
  protected String getLine()
Returns a line read from the SMTP server. This is a method simply to avoid numerous or unclear try/catch sequences.
Returns:
The line read from the server.
close 
  protected void close()
Closes the connection to the SMTP server.
